cast.original_title: Vivre sa vie: film en douze tableaux
cast.overview: Twelve episodic tales in the life of a Parisian woman and her slow descent into prostitution.
cast.title: Vivre Sa Vie

cast.overview: After a chaotic night of rioting in a marginal suburb of Paris, three young friends, Vinz, Hubert and Saïd, wander around unoccupied waiting for news about the state of health of a mutual friend who has been seriously injured when confronting the police.
cast.title: La Haine

details.biography:
Peter Kassovitz (born November 17, 1938) is a French film director and scriptwriter.

He was born in Budapest, Hungary. He left the country at the time of the Hungarian Revolution of 1956. He is the father of film director Mathieu Kassovitz. He directed the film Jakob the Liar, starring Robin Williams in 1999.

Description above from the Wikipedia article Peter Kassovitz, licensed under CC-BY-SA, full list of contributors on Wikipedia.
details.name: Peter Kassovitz
